member_organisations:
ECCVAT’s steering committee comprises of: 
 
- Charity Tax Group: https://www.charitytaxgroup.org.uk/  
 
- Wellcome Trust: https://wellcome.ac.uk/  
 
- Asociación Española de Fundaciones (AEF): http://www.fundaciones.org/es/inicio  
 
- European Foundation Centre (EFC):http://www.efc.be/ 
 
- Eurocom: http://www.eurocom.org/  
 
- European Fundraising Association: http://www.efa-net.eu/   
 
- ISOBRO: https://www.isobro.dk/  
 
- Donors and Foundations Networks in Europe (DAFNE): https://dafne-online.eu/
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Taxation
eu_initiatives: The European Commission's VAT Action Plan and proposed reforms of VAT rates
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: The European Charities' Committee on VAT (ECCVAT) was formed in 1992 because NGOs were concerned about the impact of VAT on their activities. Most taxation legislation in the European Union now comes directly from the EU and is only implemented by the individual Member States. It was clear that a single organisation representing a broad cross-section of NGOs in the EU would be able to lobby the European Union more effectively than separate national organisations.
